What is in this topic?

Give reputation points to the original owners if you want to give it.

item.title: FAQ's and general information
item.dc:creator: @vengencek0z vengencek0z
item.description:
@vengencek0z wrote:

sorry for asking a question but its somthing thats been stressing me out alot and i cannot seem to find the answer anywhere !!!
basically i own a server with a client and it all works fine i have players online and everything but i have another computer in the house which my brother uses and he wants to loggin to the server and also play. but he tries and tries and it just says error connecting. we have tried by changing the clients ip to both the server ip and 127.0.0.1 (localhost) but still no luck. please help out !!!

Read full topic

item.title: FAQ's and general information
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

Even with this extremely helpful guide with somewhat broken links, people ask questions about stuff covered here.
People think they can make a (decent) server from following guides, and videos, and reading this/other topics… They’re mistaken.
Some people are gifted with enough brain power to code and make a server, and host.
While others, are better off just playing them.
People whine, complain, and flame over how people offer help, it doesn’t work, the supplier says it does (it really does), the supply-ee failed, and whine some more about how it’s their fault for supplying a faulty code, or spoonfeeding wrongly.

Simply put, tweenagers and such lack the brain power and general thought to make a server, and then cry and flame others for offering perfectly good help that they cannot comprehend.

~Epicwuzhear.

Read full topic

item.title: FAQ's and general information
item.dc:creator: @Adelmas Adelmas
item.description:
@Adelmas wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:11, topic:142961”][anchor=faq2]Basic Questions that need to stop![/anchor]

I have seen these questions numerous times and I am tired of answering. You guys should all know to check the FAQ’s BEFORE you post a question. I have said it before and I will say it again. Since some of the FAQ’s were deleted in the switch of topics, I have re-written some of the most common ones. I should no longer see these questions.

Question = Q
Answer = A

Q: How do I make someone a mod or admin on my server?

A: Simple, all you have to do is to change player rights is open up your ‘characters’ folder (in your source) and open up the user’s file that you wish to change the player rights of. Scroll down, and you should see a line that says ‘Character-Rights =.’ You can change the number to any of the corresponding numbers below.
0 = Normal Player
1 = Player Moderator
2 = Administrator
3 = Server Owner

While you are editing this, the player must be offline. Save this, and they may log in again.

Q: Where do I download Silab’s client and how do I make it work with my server?

[color=green]A: You can download the client here. To get your server SilabSoft Client compatible, please visit this page.

Q: Where can I get a working compiler?

A: Right here.

Q: How do I make a client?

A: This type of question does not belong in the Server Development/Help section; it belongs no where. The answer to this question should be figured out without posting. So, go to the Client Hacking Section to find a tutorial on it. This type of question is showing what not to post as it is irrelevant.

Q: How do I make a server?

A: Easy, right here. If you have problems with that try this one.

These are the most basic, if I see anymore I will be sure to add them.[/quote]

About the Silabsoft one, the links don’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: FAQ's and general information
item.dc:creator: @Crazycrud121 Crazycrud121
item.description:
@Crazycrud121 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:2, topic:142961”][anchor=compile]The “Perfect” Compiler, original poster = Taharok[/anchor]

Since my making of the perfect compiler series has only made the windows batch error queries worse on this site, I decided to finish it with 2.0. The following code with never, ever break and will be much more convenient when compiled anything Java-related. Please follow the following tutorial to create your own compiler:

  1. Create a New Text Document and name it ‘compile.bat’.

  2. Right click on the ‘compile.bat’ and click ‘edit’. Then paste in the following text and save it:

::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
::							::
::	This Compiler is under no licenses and may	::
::	be distributed freely.				::
::							::
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

@echo off
if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
"%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

Now that compile.bat can be used anywhere to compile your Java files. Enjoy.

Edit: I made the following video clip that should help you with the above steps:

[/quote]

Ummm I don’t know if i did something wrong but ummmm I went to compile with the new Compiler and ummmm crap it came up with 100 errors…

Read full topic
